Name: Il Campionissimo
Description:
Italian cycling game published in the 1960's.

When the game is set up, the road cards are turned one by one, starting from the one that is farther away from the finish line. Most road cards have a rider underneath, each of the twelve different riders appears under four different cards.Every player is supposed to manage one (or more) riders. When one rider shows up, he loses strength and therefore has less chances to be the winner, which is the last rider to appear, the one under the finish line banner. The game includes items like banners, public & price money. The track is formed by cards.

Name: Le Jeu du Tour
Description:
French cycling game promoting the Tour the France published in 1937.

This game was published inside L'Auto's 1937 Tour de France programme.

Gameplay is based on the Game of Goose where geese are replaced by riders and fields have been altered to fit the racing theme. It is a roll and move game using a spiral track. Hitting certain fields help players progress faster while others slow them down. The goal is to be the first player to reach Paris.

Name: Klettermaxe
Description:
Mountain Bike game published by Simba Toys in Italy in the 1990's, a German version was also released.

The players use mountain bikes to reach the top of a mountain, the first one to reach the top wins.

Name: Juego de Salón Vuelta Ciclista a España
Description:
Spanish Cycling game promoting the Vuelta, published in the 1950's.

The board is a big two-folded wooden panel with rivets where metal riders are inserted. Riders are moved according to the result of a spinner, it also features three-dimensional mountains!

Name: Det Store Parløbsspil 6-Dagesløbet
Description:
Danish indoor cycling game published early in the 1970's.

The game represents a 6-day race in teams of two riders. One of the riders moves slowly (with 1 die) on the outer lane while the other tries to gain points by speeding (with 2 dice) on the middle lane and try to breakaway on the inner lane and gain a lap. Use Breakaway chits to move your rider to the inner lane and he'll goes twice as fast.
Play for 3 or 4 hours and have intermidiate sprints every half hour where the riders are lined up at the start line and goes one lap. Fastest rider scores 6 points, second 3 points, third 2 points and fourth 1 point.
Use points to buy extra Breakaway chits (one for 18 points).
1 Breakaway chit are given to each team at the start and after each sprint.

Name: Tarka Cycle Trail
Description: British cycling game created in Exeter, Devon. The player who follows the most efficient trail wins.

Name: Sprinter 3D
Description:
French cycling game covering the Paris Roubaix race, the Alpe D'Huez climb and an indoor race. Contains 12 riders (2 per team), 4 A3 panels and a rule set.

Players secretly distribute a given number of energy points between the riders of their team. This distribution remains secret during all the race. In every rider's turn, he choses to  throw one, two or three dice (remember,  the dice are 122223) and crosses the same number of energy points. All the riders in a group  can follow the leader of the group at no cost. Furthermore, the leader of the peloton advancess less than te thow of the dice (depending on the type of terrain). Every rider must advance at least once, can chose the dide of the road. Since the right side of the road plays frst, the rider in front of the pack will try to move to the left side of the road.

Name: The Planet Pits
Description:
Rules Introduction:
"Some astronauts have been sent to explore The Planet Pits, in search of a rare, valuable substance called Pitium. They might meet the friendly Weenie Beanies and Carrotons, or the hostile Gravel arm, the Purple Ops, Mechanico, or the vicious, giant K-9s."

Simple game mechanics: movement options are determined by either adding or subtracting the numbers rolled on two dice, and matching the result to a number printed in the spaces on the board. Landing on certain spaces on the board triggers drawing a card, which could be good (move forward X spaces, rescue cards which cancel penalties drawn later) or bad (go back X spaces, loose a turn). A math cheat-sheet is included for children who haven't yet mastered addition and subtraction, and the directions on the cards are printed in all caps to distinguish from the flavor text.

Name: Rügen Rails
Description:
Yet another Michael Mette designed and web-published variant of the well-known Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games. As with several of his more recent games, this game takes place on a much smaller map than the traditional games in the series, so small in fact, that it is limited to only 2 players.  It takes place primarily on Ruegen Island, off the northern coast of Germany.

The game can be downloaded here:
http://www.zahag.de/MMsKSg/rails/rr/main.html

Name: Get Stuck
Description:
Get Stuck is a cross between a card game and a board game.  Lay out 48 cards in a 7x7 grid with a gap in the center. One player plays black and one plays red.  Each player moves their own color card into the gap and turns it face down. Then the next player does the same.  The first player to "get stuck" and not be able to move a card loses the round and takes a point penalty.

Get Stuck can be played with 2 players or with 4 using the partnership rules.

Name: The Cost of Caring
Description:
The Cost of Caring Game for 2-6 players is played on a 23" x 23" quad-fold playing board with players advancing their own pawn by die roll along the 121 spaces (there is one short cut that saves 7 spaces) until all eligible pawns reach "the party."

A player must draw a Care Card when landing on a Care Station.  There are 60 different Care Cards, each describing the player meeting with a hypothetical person in some type of need.  Each Care Card gives a player two choices: to hurry on to the party, or to go instead to a Cost Station, where the player randomly chooses one of two Cost Cards written specifically for the situation described on that Care Card.  The Cost Card describes the player's resulting caring response and whether it gains the player a Meaning Card and whether it costs the player a Time Token.  When all 6 of a player's Time Tokens are gone, the player is out of the game.

There are 50 different Meaning Cards (plus 5 blank cards) each with a short meaningful statement, such as "care without cost would be worthless."

"The game ends when all players [who still have Time Tokens] reach the party….  The object is to arrive at the party with the most meaning cards and be declared 'SAINT'."  There can be only one.

Name: Cheerleader action-figure board game
Description: The game begins by shuffling the instructional cards.  Each player selects a colored game piece and corresponding matching colored pose-able cheerleader action-figure.  The players can combine to form teams instead of individual play.  The players are awarded trophy cards upon successfully performing dexterity actions routines with the action figures.  Once the deck is exhausted, a winner is declared.

Name: De Ronde van Frankrijk
Description: Dutch cycling game. The box contains a 64x46cm. game board, 4 teams of 3 riders and a yellow & green jersey rider. Movement is based upon using tactical cards, there are also chance cards. Like in the real Tour-de-France, the game also features mountains. The general classification is calculated by points that can be won at the finish of a stage, on top of the mountains and at the intermediates.

Name: Spritz-Duell
Description:
Spritz Duell is water game to be played in a bathtub or a swimming pool, though it could be played in a sink as well. The "board" is a round plastic ring with a net attached. This is placed in the water and four flowers each of red and yellow are placed inside the ring floating. On "go", two players fill up their squirting animals (purple and green hippo-dino looking things) and squirt water into the opposing player's flowers, trying to sink them. The first player to sink the other's flowers wins.

There is another game on BGG called Spritz Toor, and based on the description it sounds like this one but with a Football theme.

Name: Destination Fortune
Description:
Together with your fellow players, you are on an extraordinary trip that will take you around the world, into the most prestigious casinos, onto racetracks and into arenas and stadiums where you will challenge each other in all the major sports and game events. These challenges are resolved by rolling the five dice that come with the game.

This was the last game published by Ludodélire.

Name: Pass The Pyramids
Description:
A "Dicehouse" game for 3 to 5 players.

Players win or lose tokens on the toss of their pyramids, scoring points based on how they land. The winner is the player with the most tokens when one player busts.

Rules can be found at the Icehouse Games Wiki

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces

Name: Testament
Description:
(from the publisher's website)

Testament - 6,000 Years In The Making

Testament is a Bible-based tradeable card game.  The journey begins in Genesis and progresses to the end times as told in the book of Revelations.  Bible personae and locations are introduced chronologically using Testament’s time progression game mechanic. Each card features inspirational artwork from history’s masters complimented by game-play relevant scriptural quotes.
 Save The Followers

A complete match of Testament consists of two games requiring players to use the Faithful Player Pack of cards for one game 
and the Unfaithful Player Pack of cards for the next game. Players randomly choose who starts the first game as the Faithful Player.  Victory is achieved by the player who gets the most follower tokens to their Saved Zone using the Faithful Player Pack.

Name: Méandres
Description:
Contents:  a board with a spiral divided into four sections, eighteen pawns numbered from 1 to 18 (magnetic set).
The pawns are drawn at random and set face down on the first circles of the spiral. Then the players capture pawns by turning them face up in increasing order. When errors are made pawns must be moved away from the centre into the other areas of the spiral. The winner is he who captured the most pawns.

Name: Ulataksi
Description:
ULA is a Finnish acronym meaning "ultra-short wavelength" in relation to radio waves; the English equivalent is VHF or "very high frequency". The game name Ula-taxi (or Ulataksi) refers to the mode of communication between the taxi drivers and the central taxi station.

The players are taxi drivers in an unnamed city. They draw assignment cards from a deck, take money (the amount depends on which city zone they are in and where they are going) and drive to the address on the card using movement points rolled with a six-sided die. Players decide beforehand whether the game ends for example when someone has completed five assignments or when the last card in the deck has been drawn and the action completed.

During the game, the players are free to choose their routes in the streets, but movement has some restrictions: right-hand side traffic, stop signs, one-way streets etc. Violating the no-stopping sign or speed limits results in a ticket and the player loses money (for example rolling a 5 on a street with a speed limit of 3 means that the player pays 2). There are also tunnels and a ferry which give additional choices. If cars of two players collide, both go to the repair shop and the player who was moving at the time must pay a sum equivalent to the remainder of movement points on the die. Among the assignment cards there are a few cards on car maintenance, vehicle inspection and insurance which require payments and movements to appropriate locations. When the end conditions agreed upon are met, the player with the most money wins.

The rules were written in May 1968. The original game board is a paper sheet glued on a thick two-fold cardboard. The city zone payment chart is thin cardboard as are the 70 cards and the small square ferry. The game includes 100 paper banknotes with denominations of one and five. For each player there is a small plastic car and an assignment marker.

The first paragraph of the rules (translated from Finnish): "Ula-taxi is an interesting, surprising and educational game with which you will surely find entertainment. The basic idea of the game is simple, although the abundance of rules may at first feel discomforting. Once the players have become accustomed to the instructions, they will notice that the majority of them is based on general traffic regulations, the knowledge of which is nowadays common among the citizenship."

Name: Atome crochu
Description:
Contents:  a board with a central 7×7 playing area and two areas for arranging pawns, 12 white marbles and 12 black marbles, 3 sheepfold pawns and 3 nuclear pawns , 3 special dices with the symbols “sun”, “radiation” and blank faces.

The “sun” player handles the sheepfold pawns and the white marbles, while the “radiation” player deals with the nuclear pawns and the black marbles. According to the roll of the dices, players set marbles on the board which allows to build or destroy sheepfold and nuclear power stations, and to capture or to free pawns. The first to build three nuclear power stations or three sheepfolds wins the game.

Name: Roulette Russa
Description:
A giant roulette wheel with 28 holes, each hole has a number 1 to 4. Players have 5 marbles and roll them on the roulette wheel trying to make combinations.
You can score point with a combination of three of your marbles, three of the generic marbles, make a complete section (you can make a section of 7 marbles using the marble of other player), and more....
Whoever scores 50 points or more wins the game.

Name: O! EUCLID
Description:
'O! EUCLID is "an amusing and scholarly card game for ages 9-99 according to the game box top.  

There are 84 cards, 6 cards for each of 14 geometric shapes: circle, equilateral triangle, square, regular pentagon, regular hexagon, regular octagon, isosceles triangle, right triangle, rectangle, parallelogram, trapezoid, ellipse, parabola, and hyperbola.  Of the six cards, one card shows the shape and its name; one card lists 4 questions (and the true/false answers) about the shape, and four cards each with a part of the shape so that when the 4 cards are placed correctly in a 2x2 pattern, a larger version of the shape is made.

Instructions include game rules for 4 games, of which Game 2 is the basic game.  In this game players win by collecting the most complete sets of 5 cards (name card plus 2x2 pattern).

There is one instruction sheet for game rules.  There is also one information sheet listing Euclid's definitions of geometric shapes and describing their mathematical characteristics.  The information on this second sheet is not needed for game play.

Name: Mr. T Giant Card Game
Description: The Mr. T Giant Card Game is a mix & match style cared game in which players are required to complete 'poses' of Mr.T. There are four distinct poses in the 40 card set. The cards are divided into 3 separate categories: a head-shot of Mr. T, a torso of MR.T and a waist/leg card. The player that collects or completes the most poses when the all the cards are dealt, wins the game.

Name: Kali
Description:
Kali is an abstract strategy game where 2 players try to move their Prince to the center of the board. However, players must have captured five of their opponents pieces before the Prince can begin his journey. With a unique capturing mechanism, Kali is challenging and fun.

It has been played by chess master Bruce Pandolfini who pronounced it to be "The best original game I've seen in years." The strategy is very sophisticated and complex for master game players, yet simple enough for kids to thoroughly enjoy. Chess, go, pente, othello, nine men morris, checker players will love this game.

Home Page: http://gameofkali.com/

Name: Phantoms of the Ice Sonderspieler
Description:
This is a mini expansion for Phantoms of the Ice containing two cards Chameleon and Hydra, both of whom are forwards, and the special rules applying to them.

Expands:

    Phantoms of the Ice

Name: The Game of Life: Black & Bitter Edition
Description: Little is known, and little can be gleaned, about the mysterious entity known as The Game of Life: Black & Bitter Edition.  The game has elements of classic Milton Bradley Life games, but there are two boards - one fits on top of the original board.  How this affects gameplay is anyone's guess, as the rules and box are entirely in Japanese and no translation has of yet been uncovered.

Name: Taba
Description:
Description

(EN)The game of The Taba goes back to the origins of the Indo-European civilizations.

There are many variants of the game, but most of them are played with The Taba (one of the bones of the knee articulation of a sheep).

The players sit in circle and receive a secret card. Only five cards have a "title" with the names of the King, the executioner, the people, the charity and the gallows.

The King orders the executioner to apply a punishment, the people try to dethrone the King (with the help of the gallows) and Charity tries to avoid  punishment. Every action from the King will be resolved by launching "the Taba".

Descripcion

(ES)El juego de “La Taba” se remonta a los orígenes de las civilizaciones indoeuropeas.
Del juego hay muchas variantes, pero inmensda mayoria de ellas se juega con uno (o varios) huesos de astrágalo (uno de los huesos de la articulacion del tobillo de la oveja). 
Los jugadores se colocaran en circulo y se repartira secretamente una carta a cada jugador, de las que sólo cinco tendran un “TITULO” con los nombres  REY, VERDUGO, PUEBLO, CARIDAD y HORCA
El Rey ordenara un castigo el verdugo lo aplicara, el pueblo intentara destronar el Rey, con la ayuda de la Horca y la Caridad evitara el castigo del rey…todas las acciones se resolveran lanzando “la Taba”

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Vermont, New Hampshire & Central New England
Description:
This full color, mounted-on-gameboard Age of Steam expansion contains two maps with three different expansions containing unique twists on Age of Steam, including a double-map expansion with comprehensive modifications and the ability to play up to 8 players in a single game. The maps are compatible with both Age of Steam and Steam.

Vermont
Takes place in the rural forests of Vermont, where the rugged terrain and drastic seasonal changes make railroad building very expensive...but also very lucrative. This map features Seasonal Changes: Every other turn (Winter), track is more expensive. On those turns, however, you'll get a bonus income for each delivery you make. It also feature Unused Action Bonus: Any unused actions receive money, which keeps piling up until someone uses that action.

New Hampshire
Right next door to Vermont, this side of the expansion features strict anti-competitive measures that ensure there's no collusion amongst players. This map features Unique Track Builds: Track builds can not be duplicated; once a player has built a section of track between two locations, no one else can build that same connection. It also features No Track Sharing: Players must deliver goods across their own track only.

Central New England
The biggest expansion ever created for Age of Steam, allowing up to eight players simultaneously and using all the rules from Vermont and New Hampshire in addition to a few new rules specifically for this combination map, including Crossing State Lines: where goods must be delivered across state lines and Smuggle: an action which allows players to secretly deliver within the same state.

Since the expansion is a single double-sided board, two copies are needed to play Central New England.

Name: Heroscape: Skahen's Rescue
Description:
Agent Skahen was the 2008 GenCon exclusive figure, for use in the HeroScape series of games. It is a repaint of one of the Nakita Agents from Wave 5.

Just over 1000 figures were distributed, at the Wizards of the Coast booth and at tournaments, with many of them going to exhibitors due to the way Wizards of the Coast handed them out.

Name: Arnold Palmer's Inside Golf
Description:
Game is a 9-hole round of golf where each hole is laid out on a  20" x 26" card.  Players select their club and, using a standard deck of cards, draw one and consult a result chart.  Using the result and a special ruler, players move their ball markers along the hole, including possibly slicing or hooking the ball (approach shots do not conform to the slice and hook requirements though).

Each hole has standard features of a regulation golf hole, including out-of-bounds, water, and sand traps.  Hitting from the rough or from other course features may require the pull of an additional card to incur a "penalty hazard" (a modifier to your shot).

All in all, the game simulates a real game of golf with simple gameplay but decisions you would be face with in a regular game as well.

Name: Fumbly Pegs
Description:
The object of Fumbly Pegs is to get one of the colored pegs in the middle of the group each round so that at the end of all rounds you will have the most points. This is accomplished by obtaining a set of 4 or 6 matching colored cards (depending on the size of the group either one or two decks will be used) as they travel around the circle in a clockwise movement. Each deck contains 10 sets of 4 matching colored cards, one wild card, and one black card.

The center of the table contains one less peg than the number of players. Once anyone in the circle has a set they can grab a peg – after that it’s a free-for-all to get one of the colored pegs before they’re gone whether you have a set or not. Each peg is worth a different point value and one player will be left empty-handed each round, so you’ve gotta be fast to get one! Each player earns points depending on the color of the peg they grabbed. The player without a peg earns no points. Players who have unused wild cards or black cards in their hand at the end of the round lose points. At the end of all rounds the score pad will be full and whichever player has the most points is victorious!

More information about Fumbly Pegs can be found at http://www.fumblypegs.com

Name: Dice Of The Dead
Description:
escape from the dead - make your way through the living dead infested grounds and reach the safety zone. If not... you will be devoured!

Roll the dice to make your player token move and reach the green-colored zone in the game board.

Game ends when any player's token reaches the green-colored zone part of the board, that player is considered winner.

Whenever a "dead" token is moved to an occupied square with a player's token, that player is considered out of the game and its token is removed from the game board.

Name: Stench of Death
Description:
horror.
the dead are coming back to life.
mindless assassins risen from their graves,
now driven by a terrible thirst for flesh and blood.

you must escape.
make your way through and stay alive.

seek other survivors, seek tools, seek transports,
use anything you find,
defend yourself; dismember, burn the horrible corpses.
it's your life or their hunger.

beware,
the dead have risen, and their stench of death fills the air.

Run through the entire card deck -discarding all cards-;
and find as many survivor cards as you can while making your way against the reanimated dead hordes.
Equip weapons, use items, and be prepared for any unexpected events...

Whenever a player runs out of cards, all their remaining survivors will grant them award points. The more points, the better.

In multi-player games, the last surviving player with no more cards to draw and with the higher award points wins the game.

Name: Cranium Sculptorades
Description:
The "Can You Sculpt It?" game.

Mold a bowl of that comfort food you crave on a cold day. You might even find yourself sculpting a skateboard or fashioning a flamingo! Will your teammates guess what you are sculpting before time runs out?

Imagine: a whole game dedicated to your favorite classic Cranium activity! With Cranium Favorites, you'll work to get your teammates guessing funny clues as you race against the clock. Stores in a convenient container for a quick dose of fun at home or on the go!

Name: Totika
Description:
From the Publisher's website:
"Totika, a Maori word meaning “well balanced”, is a wood block stacking game unlike any other. As players pull blocks from the stack, being careful not to let it topple, they ask each other questions that focus on building self-esteem, social skills and coping strategies. As they concentrate on removing the blocks, players tend to relax, allowing them to open up and talk more freely with one another. Playing Totika will encourage people of all ages to set and achieve goals, motivate themselves, identify strong role models and form healthy relationships. Totika includes the Self-Esteem deck of questions but may be played with any card deck made by Open Spaces, LLC."

48 colored, wood blocks and 48 question cards, each with 4 questions for 2 or more players ages 8 & up.

Name: What Am I?
Description:
From the Publishers Catalog:

"What Am I? gives a clever twist to the classic game of charades, and makes guessing more fun than ever. Choose from one of over 60 pictures in the provided picture booklet, or make up your own. Then build them with a selection of colorful shapes made of chunky foam magnetic game pieces and have the other players guess what you have created.

What Am I? components: 

     an 11 x 17” double-sided folding magnetic game board, 
    a picture booklet with over 60 pictures, plus blank pages to create your own, 
    130 magnetic game pieces, and 
     a colorful illustrated instruction booklet.

Name: Paw Pals: The Dancing Ewok Card Game
Description:
In 1984, Parker Brothers released 3 card games in the Star Wars "Ewok Card Game Assortment" series: Favorite Five, Say "Cheese!", and Paw Pals.

This game is a spin-off of the Star Wars: Return of the Jedi movie with the Ewoks. This game was aimed at children Ages 4 - 8.

The players are trying to place all their cards in the "Friendship chain".

From the rules: "Like everything else they do, EWOKS have a special way of dancing. They hold up their arms and link their paws in a never-ending chain of friendship. EWOKS claim that the more they dance, the livelier they seem to feel. No doubt that's true. And you'll soon find out for yourself as you play this charming game."

The game plays by placing cards that fits the place where the paws of the other EWOKS' paws are located on the cards. Each cards placed next to another card must align the paws of the ewoks to be next to each other so that they "hold their paws". The winner is the first player to place all his cards.

Name: American Indian Map Game
Description:
The American Indian Map Game is played by collecting cards by correctly identifying Indian tribes, culture areas, language groups, or subsistence patterns, relating to the game board on which there are represented the geographic regions of 40 tribes and 10 culture areas of the U.S., Canada, and northern Mexico.

The American Indian Map Game is one in the series of Educational Materials Associates' educational Learningames.  The rules for this game are a generic set of rules that can be used for other Learningames.

Name: 'Boats 'n' Coots
Description:
This is a self-published expansion to Richard Berg's Confederate Rails.  In addition to further loads and contracts, players are now forced to deal with the interference of Confederate Generals Braxton Bragg and Joe Johnston as they lead the South into defeat.  To complicate matters further, there is now interference from Richmond as well as a Navy that believes that it has greater need of your scarce resources than your railroads.

With Confederate Rails available again from Richard Berg by inexpensive email print and play, the designer has once again made this available as well.

Name: Mega 10000: L'Encyclopédie Électronique
Description:
Box contents: An electronic box, a book of rules, 8 questions books for different domains (art, culture, science, literature, history and geography, sports, hobby, various)
Players choose first a domain and a difficulty level. Each answer to the questions is entered into the electronic box, which utters a bip and lights a spot when the answer is correct. Scores are automatically computed.
Families: Versions & Editions: Electronic Versions of Non-Electronic Games

Name: Pirates III
Description:
Join the pirates and set out on an adventurous journey with this new Pirates of the Caribbean game. You will learn what it feels like to win a fight and to go through hardship as you sail through the stormy sea. The player who, despite all obstacles, obtains the most coins from the pirate treasure is the winner.

This game is based on Het Piratenspel.

Name: Synapse
Description:
Synapse is a high-spirited game of teamwork and laughter. Form a sentence to get your team's Guesser to say a word. The Guesser has 60 seconds to get the answer...the faster you answer the more points you score. Sound easy? The catch is that team members must take turns adding one word to the sentence without consulting each other. Your synapses might not match your neighbor's. That's when the hilarity begins! Be ready for surprised looks, unusual sentence structure and outbursts of laughter as connections are made...or not! Once you start, you won't want to stop!

Description from the bottom of the Synapse box.

Home Page: http://www.synapsethegame.com/

Name: Head Hunter
Description:
Players embody fledgling companies with ruthless recruitment strategies. Each turn the companies may Hire and Fire, create patents, materials or goods, but they must also sell enough to be able to pay their employees.

The most evil aspect is stealing another players' employee by offering them a pay rise...or was it a bluff forcing the player to increase his own wage bill for no reason?!

Name: Hannah Montana Fact or Fancy
Description:
This game -- for 2 players to a whole slumber party full -- will prove if you know everything about the Hannah Montana show. by testing your knowledge and by letting you do fun activities and fact/fancy games.

Game includes:
58 Trivia Cards
20 Fact/Fantasy Cards
20 Activity Cards
4 "Pop Star" Pendants for voting
and comes in a mini guitar case

Ages 7 and up
Made by Cardinal under license by Disney.

Name: Balance: So spielt das Leben
Description: Die Autostadt GmbH and Volkswagen AG have collaborated with Ravensburger in this game of Balance. It is actually four games contained in one which all use a balance tip with a tabletop on it that will shift its position with the stacking of chips. It can be played as a basic childrens dexterity game and as a party game with cards that present social dilemmas that need to be answered with a "Yes" or "No". This game appears to have mainly been distributed by the company Die Autostadt GmbH in Germany.

Name: Medieval Battles: Legnano – 29 May 1176
Description:
This free game is the first of a new series of fast furious wargames on Medieval Battles.
Legnano is one of the most famous battles of Italian medieval history, where the Lombards defeated the German Emperor, Barbarossa.
Easy to learn system, but with a lot of chrome in the optional rules.
It comes with a 2A4 full color map and around 120 counters
Families: History: Wars of the Guelphs and Ghibellines
Series: Battles of the Middle Ages (TCS)

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Special 2008 Spiel Limited Edition – Essen Spiel & Secret Blueprints of Steam Plan #3
Description:
It's the most glorious time of the year: October in Germany, where the annual Essen Spiel takes place. It's your job to set up a network of deliveries from booth to booth, to help ensure that all vendors have the games they need to sell to the masses. Of course, each day different vendors want different games, which makes your job even harder...This map features an extra layer of strategy involving city placement that makes your brain think a little differently than in traditional Age of Steam maps.
 This limited edition (300 copies) full color, professionally-designed Age of Steam expansion contains five maps containing unique twists on Age of Steam, including a never-before seen modular expansion that allows a consistent playing experience from 3-6 players. These maps are compatible with both Age of Steam and Steam.

Secret Blueprints of Steam Plan #3 is another set of four different maps for the Secret Blueprints series (plans 1 & 2 are sold separately). This set of maps can be played together, or maps from this set can be interchanged with the maps from Plan #1.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Secret Blueprints of Steam Plans 1 & 2
Description:
Secretly devise the best plan to create a profitable railroad while your competitors do the same, sharing a common pool of actions and stealing goods directly from other players' maps with this compelling expansion from Ted Alspach.

This full color, professionally designed, printed and packaged Age of Steam expansion contains eight maps (two complete "plans") in the Secret Blueprints of Steam series and as a bonus includes full color replacement mats for Income and Goods Growth. The maps are compatible with both Age of Steam and Steam.

Because of the unique nature of these maps, Secret Blueprints plays in less than 1/2 the normal time it takes to play Age of Steam, as builds and deliveries are all done simultaneously. But there is plenty of interactivity between players, with the traditional auctioning for position to choose actions as well as the new Production action, which allows one player to pull cubes (sight unseen) directly from other players' maps.

Name: LOST The Answers
Description:
You will play as one of the survivors of the ill-fated Oceanic flight 815 which crash-landed on an island somewhere in the Pacific Ocean. You must go exploring with other survivors, visiting certain locations in order to discover answers to the many questions which surround the mysterious island.
Each time a player gains Answers Counters, the Story track will advance. When this track reaches the end, the game is over and the player with the highest value of Answers counters is the winner.

LOST The Answers is a fun, Print and Play, Card Game (which uses a board) for 2 – 5 players. You can get all the files needed to produce the game for FREE from http://mmboardgames.page.tl/MM-Board-Games.htm

This is a revamp (using several brand new elements) of our old LOST Card Game, and brings things right up to date including events from Season 4 of the show.

LOST is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making. This game is completely FREE for you to download, print and play.

Name: Jester's Dream
Description:
Simple card games, Ages 7 and up, where players are jesters on a quest to become knights for the love of their princess.
It's a DTP card game, available for print & play through Wargamedownloads, Arima and Wargaming Online

Name: War of Liberty:  An Introductory Wargame Rules for the American War of Independence
Description:
War of Liberty is a very short and simple game for simulating miniatures battles in the American Revolutionary War.  The rules themselves are only four pages long, yet detail the necessary unit structure, turn sequence, movement, fire combat, melee, and morale procedures.

Infantry units are battalions and made up of 3-6 stands (typically 2-3 stands for American and British, and 4-6 for French), cavalry is 1-4 stands (typically 2), and artillery batteries are represented by a single stand.  The game is designed to be played with either 15mm or 25mm figures.

Four additional inserts are included:
1) A game summary
2) American and French army organizations
3) British, Tory, and Hessian army organizations
4) List of American Revolutionary battles in chronological order.

Name: Glop
Description:
Contents: four series of eleven cards, numbered from 1 to 11, 1 board and 3 pawns for keeping track of the scores and of the strongest colour.

One must compare his hand with the values of those set upon the table. He choose any set of cards face-up which values add to the total of the one he chooses to play,and collect all those cards. If the captured set is of maximum size, it is called a “glop”, and this is rewarded with more scoring points. The first to raise 30 points wins.

Name: Mega Merger
Description:
(from instructions)

"Megamerger is a game where industrial empires are built through strategy and finesse, by merging single industries into powerful conglomerates.  Players acquire control of selected industries, collecting higher fees as their empires become more powerful.  Along the "Road to Riches" they find greater challenge as opponents build competing conglomerates and as each one formulates strategies for financial supremacy."

In MegaMerger players move around the board buying up shares in various industries. They can own anywhere from 5% of an industry, up to 100% in an industry. Players want to control many industries in the same color in order to make a "conglomerate" which will help them expand how much money they get from players who land on their industries.

However, just because a player owns a part of an industry does not prevent it from being bought by another player. Unlike Monopoly, as long as the player has something, they are in the game. This could be as little as 5% ownership in an industry with no money in front of them.

Name: GunCrawl: A game of Close Quarters Havoc
Description:
Guncrawl is very accessible, fast playing, scenario driven co-operative tactical skirmish game firmly entrenched in the SciFi genre.

The game boasts an innovative Universal Scenario Design system. And a clever Figure Profiler that will literally have you dusting off those little used miniatures from the shelves and converting them quickly into a multi-stated and dynamic component of the GunCrawl game as either a Player Figure or as an enemy out to stop the player from completing their mission.

 The rules are easy to understand. And the game pretty much runs itself. Allowing more time to actually play the game instead of bookkeeping and number crunching.
 The game can be played as a one off mission(depending on scenario length) in as little as 20 minutes. Or as a series of missions together as a campaign.

The scenarios/maps are built using modular tiles and various easy to assemble props with a variety of victory conditions allowing for a completely different game with each play.

Name: Here Comes the Bride
Description:
From the box back:

For girls only! Enjoy the excitement of a Bride-to-Be in selection your wedding gown, ring, shoes and bouquet. The winner of this fanciful game joins the groom on top of the beautiful wedding cake. The object of the game is to be the first player to acquire a wedding shoes wins the game. The winner places her bride-to-be on the top of the beautiful three tiered wedding cake, with the groom. Players obtain items by spinning the spinner and completing a cycle around a store or chop, or players who land on a broken heart can take away an item from another player. Each player dresser her own bride (shows on the playing board) with individually designed wedding gowns and accessories.

The designer was Bettie Levy, who created the game when she was only 7 years old.

Ages 6 and up

Name: Patriots & Loyalists:  Rules for the American Revolution
Description:
Patriots and Loyalists is a set of miniatures rules for gaming the smaller battles of the American Revolution and French and Indian War.  While designed for 25mm figures on an 8'x5' table, the game can be played with 15mm or smaller scales and adjusting movement and firing distances.

Units in the game are infantry battalions, cavalry regiments, and artillery batteries.  Typical organizations require 6-9 stands of infantry, which include command stands and stands of grenadiers and/or light infantry.  Light infantry and grenadiers can be converged into their own organizations if desired.  Units are rated A-F depending on training and morale.  This affects movement as well, in that lower grades of troops require multiple actions to carry out formation changes.

The turn sequence is as follows:

1. Active player determines number of actions available (2-4)
2. If Active player has 3-4 actions, he may use these actions to move and/or fire units as desired.  If he rolls only 2 actions, the Reactive player is allowed to Preempt or react (e.g., evading).
3. Melee phase.
4. Brigade morale phase.

Name: Robotman & Friends
Description: Players guide Robotman and three friends along four differently colored paths.  Cards show which color (character) may move.  This is a very simple color-matching game for young children.

Name: The British Are Coming! Miniatures Rules for the American Revolutionary War, 1775-1783
Description:
"The British Are Coming!" is a set of miniatures rules for gaming smaller actions of the American Revolutionary War.  The rules are designed for 15mm figures, though alternate basing for 25-30mm figures are included.  The game is scaled for 1 figure = 25 men or 1 gun.  The ground scale is 1" = 30 yards.  The rules are designed so that multiple players can play on each side, with each player commanding 6-8 units.  Units are composed of infantry battalions (3-20 figures), cavalry squadrons (2-5 figures) and artillery batteries (1-4 guns).

Turn sequence for the game is as follows:

1. Command phase
  a. First move determination
  b. Remove markers
  c. Leader movement
  d. Rallying
  e. Rout movement
  f. Activation
2. Side one movement phase (side two units may react)
3. Side two movement phase (side one units may react)
4. Fire phase
5. Charge and melee phase

Scenarios for Cowpens and Guilford Court House are included.

Name: Title Triumph
Description:
Title Triumph is sold by the American Land Title Association as a training aid for land title professionals. The base game includes 200 question cards on the topics of closing & escrow, search & exam, commitments & policies, and general industry.

A 190-card 'Level Two' expansion adds questions on these additional topics: Basic Principles of Title Insurance Underwriting, Encumbrances, Water Rights and Related Issues, Policies, Subdivisions, Uniform Commercial Code, Endorsements, Reinsurance and Coinsurance, Claims, and Legal Descriptions.

Name: Gnosis
Description: Interesting board looks like an abstract pyramid: one ground and to levels with fields to move. Each player tries to reach with his 22 wooden cylinders special fields to get 22 victory points. But the nice look disappoints in play, it's boring cause of no real strategy playing. Every player tries to run and reach some special fields with his figures and collect the 22 points.

Name: Don't get Nabbed!
Description:
This game was produced by a commercial ad agency as its contribution to the Singapore National Council Against Drug Abuse, as part of the Partnership for a Drug Free Singapore programme. Essentially applying the mechanics of the game, Snap, the game uses 60 cards (4 each of 15 designs) with illustrations of grotesque and pitiful creatures that have succumbed to the evils of drug abuse. Each card comes with a little rhyme detailing the sad fate of its character - for example:

MAK THE RABBIT
"I wish you peace" said Mak the rabbit.
His friends gave him drugs,
Now he can't kick the habit.

The cards are dealt out evenly to each player and players take turns to reveal a card from their stack. When two cards of the same design are seen, the first player to shout "NABBED!" gets to keep both stacks of upturned cards adding all of them face down to the bottom of his/her stack.

The name of the agency providing the concept and design of the game was WORK - no individual designer was indentified. The illustrations are credited to Theseus Chan and the rhymes to Jim Aitchison.

The Partnership for a Drug Free Singapore programme began earlier in 2002 and featured the characters in a series of cartoons with anti-drug rhymes. The card game was published in 2004 and was distributed in schools.

Name: 24 heures moto
Description:
Contents: a board printed on the two sides with the circuits of Mans and Castelet, 6 prototype motorbikes and 6 serials motorbikes, 24 coloured holders for motorbikes, 2 dices, 1 risks table, 1 penalty table.
This is a race game where each player can choose his speed at each move. The quicker he goes, the more risks he takes and a roll of the dices decides the penalty, namely an injunction to stay under a limited speed. The player can disobey this injunction, but if he is penalized again, then his motorbike is eliminated.

Name: Wolli, das verlorene Schäfchen
Description: In this childrens game players have to bring back lost sheep to the flock. The game comes with wooden playing pieces, a nicely drawn board and a plush sheep. Recommended for Ages 4 - 12.

Name: Kinder der Bibel
Description: Theme of this card game are stories about children in the Bible. There are 3 playing variants with 2 different sets of cards. 15 of the cards have a picture with a story from "Everyday Bible".

Name: Le Zakhia
Description:
Contents: a 13×13 board with 21 special pictured squares, 100 letters (with 3 jokers pictured as cedars), 4 holders for letters, a bag.

Players score points with 10 letters words, but they do not have to cross words. Names are allowed, and when playing upon one of the 21 special squares, the word played must refer to the domain symbolized by the picture on the square.

Name: Diploma Dogs
Description:
Diploma Dogs is an educational game that features six cuddly little stuffed dog figures: Geography Dog, History Dog, Math Dog, Language Dog, Health Dog, and Science Dog. Players move around the board collecting "bones" and "biscuits" by answering questions.

Includes a colorful board, 6 dogs, bone tokens, biscuit tokens, cards, and instructions.

This is an intermediate curriculum game designed for Ages 8 and up.

Name: Fistful of Lead
Description:
A quick play set of Wild West skirmish rules.

The game is designed for fast play, with no record keeping, other than wound and out of ammo markers. When players move is handled by an easy, random card system. Required to play: miniatures, 10-sided dice, a tape measure and a deck of playing cards. This game allows for fast and easy play, players can easily use more than one miniature.

The Fistful of Lead rules has been updated and re-released as Print-n-Play.
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=756 <-- Site has been down for a while

Reimplemented by Fistful of Lead: Reloaded.

Name: Sails
Description:
Sails - A historical miniatures game of combat between Sailing vessels of the 16th, 17th and 18th Centuries.

These rules were designed to be a medium degree of difficulty. More detail rules for fighting and moving sailing ships have been written. However, they are not
playable or enjoyable due to the need to constantly stop play in order to check the rules or a matrix. These rules were written for 1/600 scale vessels. There are also lines of 1/450, 1/900 and 1/1200 vessels on the market which can use these rules as written.

SAILS was designed to reflect ship to ship combat with squadron size the largest size battle. Regardless of the scale, as written each model on the table represents one real ship.

Play tested using many different size boards. The game can be tailored to the size of the table available. SAILS was played tested using 1 to 6 ships per player, games lasting 20 minutes to three hours, table sizes ranging from 3'x3' for 2 players to a 4'x8' for 4 players.

These rules were written using the KISS method: Keep It Short and Simple. If a situation develops that is not covered in the rules: use common sense!

Contains:
Rules
Several ship cards for those lacking
models
Event cards for some random spice

Name: Chomp
Description: Chomp is a two-player abstract combinatorial game played on a game board that is described as a rectangular "chocolate bar" made up of smaller square blocks or cells.  Each turn the players take turns removing a section that consists of all the blocks to the right and below of the chosen location.  The top left block is considered to be "poison".  The player who takes this block loses the game.

Name: The Three Block War: an Ambush Alley Mini-Campaign
Description:
The Three Block War is an Ambush Alley Mini-Campaign pack containing three interlocking scenarios. The outcome of each scenario determines what forces the Regular player will have available in the next. The scenarios may also be played stand-alone if desired.
Set in a fictional city, The Three Block War contains a generic Regular force that could be drawn from nearly any that might find itself involved in an asymmetrical war. The setting is also generic enough that the campaign could easily be transplanted to any geographical locale with no more adjustment than changing a few place names. Although written for Ambush Alley, these scenarios could easily be used for any contemporary skirmish game.
The Three Block War contains all the information and special rules necessary for play, along with Ambush Alley’s signature photographic board examples.

Expands:

    Ambush Alley! A Game of Modern Urban Combat

Name: Blue Water Navies
Description:
Rules for all aspects of naval warfare from 1910 to 1945.

These rule are designed to provide an historical and quick playing game on a 4' by 8' or smaller table. While designed for 1:2400 scale models, any scale can be used.

The distance scale is 1' equals = 3 mile. Distances are given in inches. If space is a problem, centimeters.

Ships for all major combatants of this era have been included in one of the Fleet Registries.

The Fleet Registries contains all the data required to play this game. Players should use this information when ever possible. However, many ships during the course of their life would under go changes. The Fleet Registries contains data on only one point of time for each class. Players should allow other versions of the ships provided they can be documented.

Contains:
Rules
WWI Fleet Registry
WWII Fleet Registry

Name: Zodiac
Description:
Content : 40 white and yellow pawns, a board with two parts : a fixed glass where pawns are set, and downside an octagonal board showing ten  curves (each joining 4 dots) that you can turn by an angle of 45°.

Players at their turn put a pawn above the glass and turn the octagonal board by 45°. First player to set four of his pawns upon the same curve wins.

Name: The Blue and the Grey:  Grand Tactical Rules for the American Civil War
Description:
As the game title would indicate, these are miniatures rules for fighting large scale American Civil War battles.  One infantry stand is made up of four figures and each figure is 100 men.  The basic element is a brigade, which is typically four-five stands.  The ground scale is 100 yards for 15mm or smaller; for 25-30 mm figures, all distances should be doubled.  The time scale is 1 turn = 20 minutes, which is fairly short for a grand tactical set of rules.

Game turn sequence is as follows:

1. Activation (each division or cavalry brigade rolls a die to determine if they can move effectively that turn)
2. First Move Determination
3. Combat Phase One (first mover moves and fires)
4. Morale Phase One (first mover)
5. Combat Phase One (2nd mover moves and fires)
6. Morale Phase Two (2nd mover)
7. March Phase (both sides make march moves)
8. Rally Phase (routing/retreating units may attempt rallies)

The game includes orders of battles (but not maps or scenario rules) for:  First Bull Run, Shiloh, Gettysburg, and Chickamauga.

Name: Robbies Tafel Avontuur
Description: This is an educational game designed to help children learn their multiplication tables.  The board has a number of spaces in a single path.  Players roll the die and must undertake any tasks in the space they land on.  These may be running from nasty hounds, or drawing a card and answering the math question.  First player to the end wins.

Name: Commandoes in Flames
Description:
(ADG’s Description:)

Commandoes in Flames adds a number of units and rules that can be used with Factories in Flames or with any game of A World in Flames. 
Flak units, Road and Rail line construction, Coastal Fortifications, and of course the special forces themselves are all included.


A World in Flames Expansion.

Commandoes in Flames is part of the 2008 WiF Annual that also includes:
• 200 full-colour counter countersheet
• Factories in Flames
• Commandoes in Flames
• 3d10 in Flames kit
• 1 full colour WiF Combat chart

Name: Take five
Description:
Contents: a 6×6 board, 4 series of squared pawns numbered from 1 to 9,  9 tokens for counting games, 4 chess pieces: white bishop, black bishop, black knight and black rook.

The pawns are shuffled face down and set upon the board. Then each player moves a pair of chess pieces upon the pawns and chooses one of the following option : look secretly the numbers hidden by both pawns, or look at only a single value, and capture the other pawn. The highest score wins the game

Name: Tanks Alot
Description:
Tactical combat simplified for miniature battles.

Tanks Alot is a very brief rules set the contains guidelines for creating tank units and then battling it out.

Name: Pterroductyl
Description: Pterraductyl, #2 in the Duck Trilogy, adds "tactical airborne  combat" to the world of Polywumpus. In this installment giant mutant ducks have taken to the sky. Modern technology is of no use, so adventurous pilots have taken to the air in antiques to defend mankind.

Name: Frenzied Finance
Description:
Object of game is to accumulate the greatest amount of cash and stock value.  Game time is predetermined by the players either a set time or when the bank is unable to make a purchase of stock offered it.  Game may be played by 4 to 10 players.  One player becomes the Banker and issues money and buys and sells stock for the bank.  Another player becomes the Caller who spins the price wheel, marks the stocks up or down, keeps a record of the stock prices on the price sheet, and calls the stocks.

Game parts:
One Price Board with Quick Reference Table for Computing Transactions of Over 100 shares
9 "+" up markers
1 "c" corner markers
Game Money in the amount of $2 million
1500 shares of stock in 14 companies represented
50 Price Sheets

Stock Certificates are: Oils, Cons.; Lumber Co.; Coppers, Cons.; Drugs, Inc.; Airways, Inc.; Telephone Co.; Railroad, Cons.;Steel, Cons.; Insurance Co.; Foods, Inc.; Motors, Cons.; Pictures, Inc.; Utilities, Inc.; and Equipments, Inc.

Name: The Liners
Description: Starting with a 737 players attempt to build a profitable airline in a variable economic situation.  A short one page economic game for 1-2 players.

Name: Indiana Jones Card Game 2nd Edition
Description:
The man with the Hat is back, in the Indiana Jones Card Game 2nd Edition. This FREE Print and Play card game features new artwork, some different cards, and images from all 4 movies.

In the game deck there are several artifact cards; the player with the highest value of artifacts when the last card is drawn, wins the game. Use your Action Points to defeat villains and to complete your adventures, as you try to collect the most artifacts, but watch out other players may try to steal from you.

Indiana Jones is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making. This game is completely FREE for you to download, print and play.

Name: The Game of '49
Description:
Game board has 49 rectangular card size spaces.  Each space has a theme, i.e. "The pathfinder", "prairie beef" and "Read em and weep."

Game has 49 cards that match each space on the board.  Also has "claim jumper" cards.  Lots of paper money which is called "Nuggets"

Name: Trirremes
Description:
Game included with Alea Magazine nº8.
Naval tactical game system of the antiquity. It includes three scenarios: Alalia, Artemison and Piratas.

Name: Loigny
Description:
Game included with Alea Magazine nº6.

Battle of the Franco-Prussian war.

Name: Hoplita
Description:
Game included in Alea Magazine #4.

Ancients battle game system. Includes a Battle of Cannae scenario (216 BC).

Name: Schnitzeljagd
Description:
Through field and forest is the Schnitzel Hunt.  Up to 10 hunters pursue the goal.  This isn't so simple as there are many false trails, detours, and adventures cause many delays.  The game takes luck and skill to win.

---

Kreuz und quer durch Feld und Wald führt eine Schnizeljagd.  Bis zur 10 jäger versuchen, rasch zum Ziel zu kommen. Dies ist gar nicht so einfach, den viele Fehlspuren, Umwegen, und allerei Abenteuer verursachen immer wieder Auftenhalte.  Es gehört neben dem notwendigen Glück auch eine Geschichtlichskeit dazu, als Sieger ans Ziel zu kommen.

Name: Marienkäfer Puck
Description:
A ladybug flies through the flowering seasons, from winter flurries to the end of Fall.  Through his travels he (and all of the players) learn about many flowers and about how a wonderfully pretty a planned garden can be.

---

Ein Marienkäfer fliegt durch das Blumenjahr, vom Schneeglöckchen bis zur Herbstzeitlosen.  Dabei lernt er (und alle Mitspieler) viele Blumen und auch mancherlei Getier auf einem wunderschönen bunten Plan kennen.

Name: Monopolo Esperantujo
Description: A print-and-play translation of Monopoly into Esperanto.  Adds four new cards to each of Chance and Community Chest.  The money has different sizes for different denominations and is denominated in 'steloj,' or stars.  The property names are changed as well; for example, Pennsylvania Avenue becomes 'Åœoseo de Zamenhof.'

Name: Fingerball
Description: A game of fast-action finger flickin' fun!  The game materials include a wooden playing field with a goal in each corner, 2 steel marble pucks and 8 rubber "shoes".  Each player or team takes 4 matching color "shoes" and places them on the middle and index finger of each hand. The puck is then "kicked" with the finger shoes.  Players defend their goals by staying outside of their goal lines.  Fouls can be committed and free shots are awarded.  The winner is the first player or team to score 5 goals.

Name: Port Singapore
Description:
In Port Singapore you are paid by the load.  So your team of grunts better work hard for you. But making money should not be too hard, this is the busiest port in the world.

The Port Singapore board is divided into bays. Next to the board lie the ships that need to be loaded. Each ship has a hold that needs to line up with one of your bays before you can get your grunts to load the goods (barrels).  Along the back of the board is a track on which 4 action cubes sit.  On your turn you pick up one of the cubes, do the action, then slide all the cubes forward putting your cube at the end.  Cubes usually have a cost involved in choosing them, but they get cheaper the farther they move down from the top of the track.  The actions on the faces vary from cube to cube, you may only take the action shown on the top face of the cube when you choose it.

The cubes contain actions like:

    Heave ho.  Pull a ship along the wharf or send full ships off and get new ships to load. Good for annoying players who may be about to load or bringing a ship to your warehouse bay.
    Union meeting.  Shuffle you grunts around the wharf and roll one of the action cubes for a random result. 
    Do business.  This gets goods in your ware house to load or lets you hire grunts to do your loading.
    Load a ship. Move one load per grunt into a ship's hold opposite to your warehouses.
    Take a bribe.  Helps you get things done.
    The Payoff.  Pay one of your opponent's grunts to simply go home for the day.
    Brawl.  Cause a ruckus in the bay next to one of your bays, good for disrupting opponents.


The game ends when the barrels in the supply run low (depending on the number of players).  The player who has made the most money wins.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Chile, Egypt and CCCP
Description:
A trio of expansions that were released by Alban Viard at Essen 2008. The print run was 120.

Chile is a long, narrow map approximately twice the size of a normal expansion and features extremely valuable gold cubes. For 4-6 players.

Egypt is notable for its flood and pyramid mechanics, both of which alter the gameplay in substantial ways. For 3-5 players.

CCCP is a unique new map with altered victory conditions. For 3-6 players.

Name: USA & Canada Pegboard Football
Description:
Pegboard Football is based upon a wooden rectangular board with peg-holes indicating 5-yard increments that are off-set alternating every 5-Yards from one side of the field to the other, representing an entire American Football field, or the Canadian version for one when modified for that, stretching from Goal Line to Goal Line.

Components: 

    Board with peg-holes depicting 5-Yard increments and the GOAL lines at each end of the FIELD.
    2-Pegs of different colours are utilized, to denote the current Player having possession during PLAY. 
    2 d6 required as a minimum, although a 3rd d6 can be used to track DOWNS. 


Alternative methods for creating this:
 1) Magnetized Version: With the appropriate materials at your disposal, then you can affix some reasonable DISPLAY of the Playing Field upon a metallic surface conducive to adhering the necessary components for this. That is in place of constructing it out of anything in which peg-holes were to then be used, for where this is so desired.

2) Paper/Cardstock Materials: From whatever types of this for which you have on hand, and that you can provide the required components needed in order to PLAY, then by all means use such to implement everything and ENJOY!

Name: Rug Amuck
Description:
RUG AMUCK
Ahtnam's Flying Carpet Marketplace has experienced an unexpected magical surge, which has caused the neatly piled flying carpets to run amuck.

The players, representing apprentice carpet riders, attempt to impress Ahtnam by organizing the showroom before doors open for business.

RUG AMUCK is a matching game where players are attempting to match pairs of flying carpets. The player who matches the most pairs will impress Ahtnam and be named the Master Carpet Rider. Just pay close attention to the carpets that all look somewhat alike, and don't forget to watch your back.

Rug Amuck includes:
48 flying carpet tiles (24 pairs)
5 apprentice pawns
1 die
5 player summary cards
1 rules sheet

Rules sheet includes 3 methods of play ranging from friendly to cut throat.

Name: Pokémon Munchin' Munchlax
Description: Similar to Mr. Mouth, the Munchlax head rotates in the middle, with the mouth opening and closing as players attempt to launch small plastic pieces of food into it within the allotted time. Players are then scored based on how much food they managed to get into Munchlax's mouth (20 points for a triangle "cheese" piece, 10 for a round "apple" piece, and 5 for a "donut").

Name: Adventures of Riley: Penguin Rescue
Description:
From the publisher's website:

"Get ready to travel across Antarctica with Riley and his family as you race to rescue five penguins in danger and return them home safely! Packed with informative facts, twists and turns, Penguin Rescue is based on the award-winning book Adventures of Riley: South Pole Penguins."

On a player's turn, two dice with colored faces are thrown.  The player may elect to resolve the dice in either order, which offers one of the minor strategy points in the game.  One side of the die says WILD which allows a card to be drawn which immediately has an effect on the player (move back, move ahead etc).

Be the first to collect a full set of the five colored penguins and return to home to win.

Name: Turtlemania
Description:
From the publisher's website:

"Based on an ancient Chinese Mahjong game, race to dismantle 136 colorful and uniquely designed tiles by matching identical pairs as fast as you can. The more quickly you make matches, the more points you earn!"

The action is simultaneous and frantic.  Players quickly pull matching tile pairs from among the free outside edge.  (Some tiles are deceptively similar without actually matching!)  The player or team with the most pairs wins.

Name: Power Grid: China/Korea
Description:
The 4th expansion for Power Grid, with boards for Korea and China.

The Korean board comes with two separate resource markets (North/South).

The Chinese board has rules for the planned economy in China - power plants come out in ascending order during step 1 and step 2.

Expands:

    Power Grid

Name: fun-et-iks
Description:
"The play on words game"

From the instructions:
Solve the who, what or where questions and race to the center square. At the center square, solve a scrambled question to win the game.

Name: Oil Tycoon
Description:
From the back of the box:

During the years since Col. E. A. Drake brought in his first oil well in 1859, the Discovery of Oil has made more men wealthy than any other single endeavor.  Oil, now as then, is just waiting to be discovered.  Yet, only a few men - a special breed of men - seem to solve its Mystery and find it.  What do these men possess that sets them apart from the average person?

They are almost always bold and intelligent... they know Land Values and how to collect and analyze clues.  Their Business Prowess enables them to expand their oil fortune by Investing in other enterprises. They not only own vast empires, but control them with their own decisions. Indeed!  Few people qualify for the extraordinary title of "Oil Tycoon"

CHALLENGE
This game offers you an opportunity to see if you have what it takes to join those elite ranks! You will receive an inheritance to start your own empire.  The oil is out there somewhere just waiting.  The rest is up to you.  With skill and a little luck, you might become the next "Oil Tycoon."

Name: Biz-bluff
Description:
Contents: a board representing a town, 4 coloured pawns, 4 credentials cards, 12 business folders, 20 “biz-bluff” cards, a dice.
Players sell and buy stocks, trying to earn as much as possible from opponents, and of course, to be the wealthier at the end of the game. Pawns movements are decided by the dice, and so are the cards to be drawn, but it is mainly a game of bluff and memory.
